clinical_study.brief_title: Randomised Study to Compare the Effect of r-Hu-EPO Administration With Transfusion of Red Blood Cell Concentrates and Also With the Administration of Polyvitamins in Anemic and Tired Patients Presenting a Bad Prognostic in Middle Course
clinical_study.official_title: Randomised Study to Compare the Effect of r-Hu-EPO Administration With Transfusion of Red Blood Cell Concentrates and Also With the Administration of Polyvitamins in Anemic and Tired Patients Presenting a Bad Prognostic in Middle Course

lead_sponsor.agency: Gustave Roussy, Cancer Campus, Grand Paris

clinical_study.source: Gustave Roussy, Cancer Campus, Grand Paris

brief_summary.textblock: Randomised study to compare the effect of r-Hu-EPO administration with transfusion of Red Blood cell concentrates and also with the administration of polyvitamins in anemic and tired patients presenting a bad prognostic in middle course.

primary_outcome.measure: Quality of life, in particular when related to tiredness (FACT F)

clinical_study.condition: - Medico-Economic Aspects (Evaluation of Medical Costs Related to the Three Strategies and Evaluation of Cost/Efficacy)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Both sexes
- 18-70 yrs
- metastatic or locally advanced cancer
- Life expectancy > 3 months
- hemoglobin between 7 and 10 g/100ml
- no contraindication to r-Hu-EPO
- with written informed consent at entry time
